climbs.name: Tunnel of Love
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Bob Gaines, Feb 2009

content.description: This is the crack system right of Love Bandit. Climb a somewhat unprotected squeeze chimney, then (staying in the right branch of the crack) stem and jam your way to the top. Beware of numerous loose flakes.
content.location: To descend: scramble down to the B for Beers anchor and rappel 50 feet.

climbs.name: Tap Dancing
climbs.fa: (TR): Bob Gaines & Pat Nay, 10/86, (Lead): Mike Lechlinsi, 12/87

content.description: Located on the left side of the Negropolis formation. This is a steep face climb up the outside face of the largest pillar. TR or X rated lead.
content.protection:
If you're leading it, you're essentially soloing once you get about half way up. Originally led with only two knifeblade pitons and a thin nut or two for pro.

There is currently one fixed knifeblade about 15 feet up.

There is a 2 bolt anchor with chains on top.

content.description:
Located on the far left side of the Negropolis formation.

Begin from about 20 feet up the gully left of Slab Prancing, moving right on to a face with a thin crack.
Located on the far left side of the Negropolis formation. Start at a chimney, moving on to the face at a thin flake, then 3 bolts on a slab to the top.
content.location: Best descent is probably to downclimb to the top of the Tap Dancing pillar, and rap from the bolts (with chains).

content.description:
Located on the left side of the Negropolis formation. Climbs the steep face on the right side of the Tap Dancing pillar.

10c if you climb the face at the start without stemming on the back wall.
content.protection:
2 bolts plus some thin nuts and CDs.

2 bolt anchor with chains on top.

content.description:
Begin about 20 feet right of Tap Dancing and climb a flake up to a slightly overhanging bulge (crux) then up the steep face joining Crossover for its final 2 bolts. (6 bolts total).

The main hazard of this route is a big Yucca with sharp spines near the base. Take care when leading or toproping (due to rope stretch) not to fall into the Yucca!

climbs.name: Metal Highway
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Brian, Jenn, Steve Orr, Rob Raker, Annette Bunge

content.description: This obscure climb does not see too many ascents, which is sort of a shame, because it has lots of interesting climbing on it. It has chimney, face, crack, mantel; all sorts of climbing on it. Worthy of a visit.
content.protection: Two bolts, one or two fixed pins (thus the name "Metal Highway"...lots of fixed pieces). Bolted anchor/rap on top.
content.location: Sort of right in the middle of the Negropolis clump, left of B for Beers and right of the Lechlinski routes.

climbs.name: Love Bandit
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Alan Bartlett, Feb. 2009

content.description: Begin just uphill and right of B for Beers and climb a low angle face to a steep arete with three bolts up to the B for Beers anchor.
content.protection: 1 to 3 inch pro for the start, then 3 bolts to a 2-bolt belay/rap anchor.

content.description: "Just Smrz It" ascends a steep face, on the left shoulder of Negropolis, via a thin crack with a pod. Where the crack ends continue face climbing on flakes and edges to an overlap split by a crack, near the top. Pull the splitter crack in the overlap and continue up the face and blocks to the top.
content.location: Located south of the saddle between The Pet Cemetary & Negropolis. On the left (north) shoulder of the Negropolis, up and left of Slap Dancing & Tap Dancing on the Tap Dancing pillar.

content.description: This route is on a rather large black block, somewhat up and right of the B For Beers route.  Starts around the rightmost corner.  Bolted protection
Start just right of Girls in the Mist and climb the face at a vertical white dike.
content.protection: 2 to 4 inch CDs for the anchor.

content.description: From the same elevated starting ledge for Astrophy, traverse past where Astrophy quickly turns vertical, to go across further rightward for approx 20 ft more to a fun bit, that connects with the easy crack that stays to climber's right of and parallels the upper half of I Fall Therefore I Am.  Finish upward and rightward along jugs leading to the bolted rap anchor atop Metal Highway.  Done by having gone off route from Astrophy.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5", bolted rap anchor atop Metal Highway.
content.location:
Elevated starting ledge accessible from topout of Slap Prancing, or partway up I Fall Therefore I Am.

Rap from Metal Highway anchor with one 60 m rope.

climbs.name: Dancing With The Scars
climbs.fa: Tucker Tech, Bob Gaines & Alan Bartlett, 2/09

content.description:
Located on the left side of the Negropolis formation.

Begin 30 feet left of Dance On Fire in a deep alcove/corner. Jam/chimney/stem a burly crack in a flare (5.9+/5.10a) then climb a delicate face (5.9+/10a) past two closely-spaced bolts to the top of the pillar.
content.protection: 2 to 4 inch CDs, 2 bolts to a 2 bolt belay/rappel anchor.

content.description: Steep, runnout face climbing past three bolts on the left side of the Tap Dancing pillar.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2 bolt belay/rap anchor on top.

content.description: This is a steep, exciting face climb on high-quality rock. Begin with the first two bolts of Rap Dancing, then move left to the arete and climb past two more bolts on impeccable rock up to a 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection:
4 bolts, optional thin nut just above the first bolt, but even with the nut it's still PG13 to the second bolt.

2-bolt anchor (70 feet).

climbs.name: B for Beers
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Mike Brown & Craig Fry, October 1985

content.description:
Climb a slab past two bolts to reach a left-slanting dike system which is followed up to a third bolt where you'll encounter the crux. Once past the crux one more bolt leads to anchors at the top.

Enjoyable moves, quality rock and the suberb view from the top make this a route worth seeking out if in the area. Two stars out of five.
content.location:
This lies to the right of the actual Negropolis formation on a similar sized pillar of rock with a slanting dike system and down and left from the block with

Girls in the Mist

.
